column4: well, leave the cable plugged in and type this in the terminal, ifconfig

the problem is that ifup doesn't know about the eth0 interface. It's not in the interfaces file.
all he needs to do is add "auto eth0" to the bottom
It did, I checked that first. eth0 is there, and the driver "forcedeth" is loaded
nothing at all in interfaces about eth0. "cat /etc/network/interfaces | grep eth0" returns nothing
I'll bet the interfaces file didn't get written during the install because there was no cable connected to the internet
